page.title: 02Haytor granite tramway
page.content: Just to the north of Haytor rocks can be seen the disused remains of granite quarries and a granite tramway. The tramway was used from 1825 to 1858 to carry the stone down to the valley at Teigngrace where it was shipped on barges via Stover Canal and the River Teign to Teignmouth and loading onto sea-going vessels. The quarry became uneconomical to work as a result of the double shipping transfers. According to Brian leMessurier's Dartmoor guide book, 'Walks for Motorists' the granite tramway "reverses the normal railway technique which has the flange on the wheels and employs simple rails. Here the retaining flange was on the rails, or sets, and the material was available for the cost of extraction." (p.48)
